page.title: 15Cattle Market in Banbury (2)
page.content: The bigger pigs are in pens for one or two pigs and the size of the pen is about 50cm by 1m, but they don't mix male and female. The pigs all have a mark on their backs.Out of all three animals the pigs are the ones which get ill more often. The sheep are like the cows, kept both outside and inside. They are in pens which measure about 1m by 2m. In each pen there are a lot of sheep. There are a lot of vets and they all work at different times looking for diseases in the three different animals. There are also a lot of auctioneers selling the animals. We had to be careful not to let our fingers twitch in case we bought something.
